primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God fulfills His ancient promises to Abraham and David by breaking into history through the genealogy of Jesus, incorporating the marginalized and sinful through grace.

tekstueel_bewijs: He made a promise, and he came through with it.
Jesus Christ... has opened a cleft and punched a hole in the pitiless walls of the world.

object.identificatie: The fulfillment of promise and the inclusion of 'outsiders' into the family of God.
tekstueel_bewijs: all the families of the earth would be blessed
A promise was made to both David and Abraham.

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Outsiders' (Tamar, Rahab, Ruth, Bathsheba) and the Hearer.
tekstueel_bewijs: if you’re saved by sheer grace, you’re equally loved.
He is not ashamed to call us brothers and sisters.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver/Beneficiary of grace.

helper.identificatie: The Genealogy (as a record of grace) and the Incarnation.
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ is that ultimate reality
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who acts through the Helper (the historical record).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the one making the 'reality' felt by the hearer.

tegenstander.identificatie: Time, Death, and the 'Pitiless Walls' of the factual world; also Human Merit (Résumés).
tekstueel_bewijs: the pitiless walls of the world
the land of the killer résumé
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but the ontological weight of death and the 'concrete slab' of a world without God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response to grace: rejecting worldly status and finding identity in Christ.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A new identity and a community that ignores worldly 'résumés'.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical response (Program 2) is presented as a direct consequence of the grace established in Program 1.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We usually take a look at Matthew.
You have to have a great résumé.

voorbeelden: We must not be like out there in the world.
You should at least want that to be true.
The stuff we’ve longed for in the stories.
Jesus Christ... has opened a cleft.
He’s the love who can get you out of your self-made prisons.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to break the power of death and sin, rather than the hearer's 'obligation' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Boring' Law/Genealogy (~S1) to the crushing reality of Exclusion (S2), then reveals the hidden Grace (S1) that incorporates the excluded (~S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ becomes the Subject who satisfies the Law's exclusion by bringing the 'unclean' into his own résumé.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon explicitly mentions that the Law 'permanently excluded' these women.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently makes God the subject of the action. Even when discussing human sin (Tamar, David), the focus is on God's inclusion of them rather than their effort to change.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ is that ultimate reality to which all the stories point.
He’s saying [David] is no better than the prostitute.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The biblical figures are used as examples of God's grace, not as moral models for the hearer to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: these figures prove that God saves the lost.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance; identity is moved from performance to belonging.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: God acts, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical genealogy to the 'myth-become-fact' argument is structurally seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'factual world' and 'reality' is resolved in the Incarnation.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He’s saying David the king had no more of a right... than a prostitute... anyone who relates to God will have to be related through sheer grace.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Christological 'Pouvoir' than the Pneumatological 'Pouvoir'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is seen as a permanent barrier to God's presence that only God can remove.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the primary actant (Subject) throughout.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the Advent theme of 'God coming to us'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Perhaps slightly more on how the Spirit provides the 'Vouloir' (desire) to live out this new identity.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of how a 'boring' text can be analyzed to reveal the deep structure of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'myth' illustration, Greimas shows that the illustration serves to switch the Subject from 'Man trying to live a myth' to 'God making myth fact'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the names; semiotics explains why the names function as a 'résumé' that Christ subverts.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Mothers' are not just characters but actants of 'Inclusion' that block the 'Opponent' of Legalistic Exclusion.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Be like David' trap by highlighting David's sin to level the playing field for grace.
